column4: Can I get apt-get/aptitude/dpkg to overwrite a package with anothre version of the same package - no matter if the version I am installing is older?
apt-get install --reinstall should do the trick
then it's not in your repo anymore. What version does apt-cache show gcc
gcc-4.0-base - The GNU Compiler Collection (base package)
maybe try --download-only or download with wget and install with dpkg ...
not using apt might break your system though.
how do I make dpkg reinstall?
great. Hope it solves the problem. Not using irc loopback anymore. Promise.
I need "older" versions of libstdc++6 and libgcc1
